result.execSummary:
The defendant Nicholas Mark Connolly was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Must notify Probation no later than 4:30 pm on 4/25/16.  May petition the court for early discharge if probation feels appropriate.

miscConds.notes: Not to possess or use drugs or drug paraphernalia.

Must follow conditions of supervision.
Must provide DNA sample.

supervisions.notes:
Subject to Good Time & Work Release.
24 days sentence = TIME SERVED.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Nicholas Mark Connolly

CASES: 15CM341 & 16CM113.  02:05 PM Defendant Nicholas Mark Connolly in court with attorney Lynne McMullen.  Defendant Nicholas Mark Connolly in custody.  James Jay Rennicke appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  CW-clerk.  

15CM341-Count 1-Poss THC-30 days PCJ, subj to GT & WR.  Time served.  24 days credit, time served.
16CM113-Count 1-Retail theft-60 days PCJ, consec to 15CM341, subj to GT & WR.  46 days credit, time served.  Restitution $18.21 to be paid to COCC within 10 business days., ftp-reduced to civil judgment.  Any other fines/costs reduced to judgment if not paid within 10 days.
PCR.  2:23 pm adj.
